page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY-PAXFORD AREA
page.content: Village names derive from Old English, indicating early settlements.A Roman Villa excavated in 1958/9 was later filled in.A Saxon charter of 1005 mentioned Battle Brook.Other names for farms & fields appear at Enclosures. Origins: Eadboerts Farmstead-Ebrington Enclosure of Caefors people-Charing- worth.Enclosures in a valley-Campden. Paecc's Ford-Paxford,this was across the Knee(crooked) Brook.All O.E.deriv- ations.Ebrington church,dedicated to a Saxon St.Eadburga,has a Norman arch.A monument commemerates the Cow Charity of 1632,still administered today. Paxford Church,donated in 1866,ceased to be a day school in 1910. Fields:Environmental names e.g.Flag Head,Coddleapple & personal names e.g. Newitts came after Enclosures.Opening of railway in 1853 gave Railway Field. The 3 Mills are O.E.derivatives.
